bibl.title: A. A. De Meules v. John H. McGraw. Commitment.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
United States of America.
Territory of Washington, County of King ss.
To the Sheriff or any Constable, and the Keeper of the Jail of such King County:
Whereas, At a Justice's Court, held at my office in said County, for the trial of John Doe name unknown and refused for the offense hereinafter stated, the said John Doe. was convicted of having, on the 15 day of August 1889, in the said County, committed the crime of assault and Battery upon Irving Ballard of Slaughter. King Co. and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that the said John Doe. aforesaid should pay a fine of fifty Dollars and 13 20/100 Dollars costs, and stand committed until the same be paid; and, Whereas, the said John Doe. has amde default in the payment of the same;
Therefore, You, the said Sheriff or Constable, are hereby commanded in the name of the United States of America forthwith to convery and deliver the said John Doe. to the said Keeper, and you, the said Keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said John Doe into your custody in said jail, and him there keep at hard labor for the space of the number of days required by law days, unless said fine and costs be sooner paid, or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law.
Dated This 15th day of August 1889. James Hark. Justice of the Peace. in this King County
7071 Committment TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON vs. John Doe. Name unknown hefased
FILED Aug 20 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. H. T. Harmon Deputy Clerk.

Filled 15 Aug 1889 Jua Hark Justice of the Peace.
LOWMAN & HANFORD STATIONARY AND PRINTING COMPANY. Seattle, WASH. TER. Dealers in all kinds of Legal Blanks, and Territorial Agents for the Fisk Patent Court Tocket.
COMMITTMENT BLANK No. 42.
